Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JwbpDhcPwVmILU6wvvcBzw.text: Beautiful restaurant! The outdoor patio is dreamy! They have misters outdoor to make the environment refr

7_QRXjjqfGIp5laFi5on-A.text: I made the reservation one month before I went there said I want the seat which close to the fountain. The front desk said we can sit first, and move the seat later. During the meal,  we asked the waitress, a brown hair lady, she told us "they are not allow me to move you to another seat." Who are they?? I totally don't understand, why we can't move the seat, but the front desk said we can.

X6lQ9FCbcpHW53QNACTV6A.text: With the great reviews we were excited to try this place. As we came to the hostess counter we were met with great attitude despite trying to be nice. We asked if we could sit in the patio , they said your seat will have some view..... then as we sat in the patio we were given a time limit rudely of 1 hour and 45 min??   Then the weighter came who was very nice and accommodating . Out of curiosity I asked people sitting on the next table if they had the same time limit. Response was yes , they also said they have been there twice and have received the same rude attitude.   Then I'm like whatever hopefully food is great and it's all worth it .NOPE , I tried 4 dishes and food was very bland . I Thought something was wrong with my taste buds , but everyone on the table agreed .   For a restaurant of this caliber honestly could've had better food and better service at some cheap burger joint .   Hopefully the management sees this review and provides training to their staff .

GE0NeueSPJPXju77QDVtTg.text: This place was a nice find for us.  We were walking around Bellagio looking for a place to eat and Lago seemed to be the only place open for lunch on their side of the casino.  The restaurant didn't look too impressive from where we stood at the hostess desk, and I didn't understand why they were taking us outside as it was kind of cool that day and then....Hello great view!!!!  Overlooking the "lake" and looking at the fake Eiffel Tower was fantastic and put us in a very good mood.  We ordered the following:  Arugula salad:  fantastic Veal ravioli:  excellent Chicken parmesan panini:  Terrible/bland; trust me, don't order it  Our waiter was very attentive  This will be one of our "go to" spots the next time we're in town

AeM7v5e_-roC8zW6Y_gOcg.text: This is a great Italian tapas restaurant on the strip.Everything on this menu is great!Even the pizza is soooo good! We were lucky to have a patio table facing the fountain! Absolutely fantastic fountain view! From the fountain view to the food and service,Lago deserves a 5 star rating!

3aHjMAuomjRxBVq7oL6EJg.text: Perfect date spot - just be sure to make reservations and ask for a table with a view of the Fountains at Bellagio!  My husband and I ate here during the week on a recent trip to Vegas, making reservations about one day in advance for a late dinner.  The view of the Fountains during our meal was spectacular - I would recommend asking for a table up front towards the windows or on the patio for the best of the best.  The service was nice, but not as personalized or as steady as we expected.  Our server forgot to put in our appetizer and salad orders, and was slow to bring drinks from the bar, but overall he was polite and knew his way around the menu.  We had the Bruschetta as an appetizer, and it had a nice little kick to it from the garlic oil, then had the minestrone soup and the Ceasar salad as our next course.  The minestrone was extremely light but flavorful, and the Ceasar salad was crisp and nicely dressed - having those two dishes for lunch would definitely be a great idea!  We stuck to traditional favorites for our entrees, and the lasagna (not sure they have it every night), and the pappardelle did not disappoint.  Both were filling and you could really taste how fresh the pasta was.  I would recommend either one if you are going to have a multi-course meal, because even with all of that food, we still had room to try their gelato and maybe an extra martini or two.   Overall, the beautiful atmosphere and view of the Fountains is probably enough to make us go back to Lago again (it truly is one of the most romantic restaurants we have been to in awhile in Vegas!), but it's the fact that the food is so fresh and so delicious that makes us want to recommend this restaurant to others as one of our new favorites in Vegas.  Cheers!

6S1JRHwrEEDVXbcLkaYHKg.text: Tried Lago again, and over a weeks time in Vegas I ate lunch here several times.  The lobster fettuccine was amazing.  And try the small pizzas.  It's a great menu and the food is wonderful.

zFjolo2upEqyO84fmk_32w.text: Brunch was amazing! For only $38 per person this is a great value. Your Brunch begins with a pastry basket, followed by two courses and finally a desert bar! We selected Raviolone which is stuffed with egg and truffles and my daughter loved it! I had the salmon salad followed by the Frittata which was scrumptious. The service aaa also excellent and the best part is the view of the Fountain show! It was stunning! Highly recommend!

94UElpu-HwnCXUe0nnGKmg.text: I was expecting so much more of this restaurant. The food was very mediocre and nothing particularly wowed me. I had the short ribs, side of mushrooms, stuffed squid, and Langostino's. Everything tasted rather bland. I definitely don't mind spending a pretty dollar for a fantastic meal. However, I found this particular meal to be rather boring.Looking forward to trying other fine dining spots on my next trip to Vegas.

0FK9CdOQ_fQrnz-6kTG5rg.text: Great service . I had the mistro it was delicious with the margharita pizza . Great decor . Lunch menu not as much options

xOdMHJK39WaEI1A7rJNE0g.text: Great view of the fountain at Bellagio.  Our waiter was Italian, which is nice since it's an Italian restaurant.  Food was delicious, meat perfectly cooked!  Friendly staff too!  A wonderful dining experience!

diWufgb3sGoMTup-u7j5EQ.text: I was recently in Vegas with a large group (over 20 people) and was pleasantly surprised when I found out we would be dining at Lago for dinner. This place was on my list, so getting to check it out was fun!  First of all, the decor and ambiance of this place is top notch. It's gorgeous on the inside and has floor to ceiling windows that provide a good view of the fountains from many of the tables. We were seated directly across from the bar close to the pizza oven (so about halfway into the restaurant) and could still see the top of them. I would not want to sit at the front of the restaurant because it's open to the casino and just doesn't seem quite as special.  Second of all, the food! I enjoyed almost every dish that we ordered. The plates are small and pretty pricey, so take that into consideration (the 4 star rating), but hey, it's Vegas. It's kind of part of the whole deal. We ordered... - CAPRESE - MARGHERITA PIZZA - RISOTTO AI FUNGHI E PARMIGIANO - FUSILLIORO - GNOCCHI ALLA ROMANA (My favorite... like clouds!) - COSTA DI MANZO - SCALOPPINA DI VITELLO (the only thing I didn't eat bc I don't eat veal) - CHEESECAKE  I would definitely recommend this place for a True Vegas dining experience. Get a table close to the fountains for sure. You can even order a $60K bottle of wine while you watch! :)

2QGQvA4vTbHpMOOfbLj0rQ.text: Have been here before for brunch and am always drawn back because of the fountain view. But this night we made a last minute reservation, sat at the bar and had a truly great experience, even when just expecting a casual bite. The food was fantastic and the server was friendly, attentive, while also allowing privacy. Great experience and amazing drinks!

qCe0JhnoYPn46BaCJRDUbw.text: I've attended the Gold Elite Event, as well as several other times for client lunches.   The dining space is open, bright, modern, fun, but yet welcoming. I think there are ideas that I would take into my own home one day. For example, the chrome shelving at the bar with the white background pops!  If it is a nice day, it is nice to sit on the Patio, but it's also nice to be casual and sit at the bar. No bad options here.   For the food - I really like the tapas idea since I'm always one to share and try many dishes during a meal.  Some of my favorites:  -Caesar Salad with mini hearts of Romaine -Caprese, simple but flavorful -Braised pulled duck meat with polenta - Like butter!  -Italian Fries - Yas!   Lago started to serve Brunch and I need to check it out soon!!

zaHtfdiudv7mDJhm8zaV5w.text: I have reviewed Lago before, but insomuch as it is my favorite spot on Earth, I must reiterate. The patio overlooking the Fountains of Bellagio at sunset is spectacular. I love nothing more than sitting on the Lago patio nearest the rails looking out at the fountains with the Eiffel Tower in the background. The wonderful wines they serve paired with the delicious food designed by Julian Serrano, and served by the fine staff are the highlight of our every visit. Our Brazilian waiter was knowledgeable about every item on the wine list, and dinner and dessert menus. He provided excellent information that guided us to perfect selections. Everything was so delicious. We can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It just doesn&#39;t get any better than this.

TFAswxnw-u_xammXRHqyJg.text: Lago is fantastic. Call before you arrive at your hotel to make a reservation so there is not an issue, it does get crowded and sold out. It is located at the Bellagio, a beautiful hotel. The location is perfect. If you want to sit near a view of the Bellagio fountains ask, speak up.  Please do not go dressed in shorts looking like you are on line at a cheap buffet. Dress for the occasion, wear a nice pair of pants and anything other than flip flops. This is an expensive place to eat, it is beautiful, the food is great, so treat it as such. Everything on the menu is wonderful. Try a steak and a fish dish. They have a pizza oven and I am sure it is great, but I did not have pizza, so I don't know. The service is wonderful, you are well taken care of and they make you feel special. If you are there for a special occasion let then know before you are seated.  I would not take kids here. You can, but they are going to get bored, you will be there awhile.  They have wonderful desert items. If you can afford it have a bottle of wine, but I don't think their list is the best and it is very pricey. I rather spend my money on the food, oh the food. But you do what you want. They have a full bar with great drinks. You will be there for an hour or more. It is not that they are slow at all, the food is perfect and you simply are not rushed. If you are in a hurry, go elsewhere. Enjoy.

NaeyrKUJCtY-tzEB5Dw6IA.text: I went to largo and it was horrible servis , took to long for food and the food wasn't that great. CARLOS  my waiter didn't attend my needs.  The front desk knew that it was also my birthday I had asked in advance to sit outside IN ADVANCE and they had nothing available when I arrived . Also charged for the fake ... over priced for what the quality of the food is !!! Don't reccomend this place !

msu70-L60YxKpwGy3pyxqQ.text: I came here for lunch on a Sunday thinking I could order the agnolotti.  Sadly on Sunday at lunch they served only a brunch.  So I tried the brunch and came back at dinner the next day for the agnolotti.    The brunch rated as a 4 stars.  I had the mixed antipasto Italian meats.  Basically some very good prosciutto and excellent salami.  That salami was divine.    I then had the eggs and Applewood smoked bacon that had a very small portion of gratin potatoes.  The two eggs were sunny side up although I had asked for over medium. Eggs tasted good, bacon was delicious and had a strong smoked flavor.  The potatoes were ok.    Someone in group had the duck on a cheesy polenta. I got to taste it and it was delicious.     The dinner rated a 5 stars plus.   All the portions are small so you get many different tastes as I ordered a four course meal.  Again I had the mixed Italian meats as an appetizer. Most excellent!  Then I had the veal agnolotti in a meat sauce.  It was delicious, as good as the finest restaurants in Turin Italy where I first tasted this dish.  I get tired of American Italian restaurants always serving most of the pasta dishes with a tomato based sauce.  This beef based sauce had no tomato in it and was the consistency and taste of gravy. My next course was the veal piccata.  The sauce was excellent.  The veal delicious, great flavor and the only criticism I have is that the veal was not tender.  It was still a great piece of meat.   Dessert was a German chocolate Black Forest cake with cherries.   What a dessert!  The wine was a glass of Barbera D'Asti, a deep red wine that had a dark berries nose.   At $110 per person it was a bit expensive but then this is Vegas!

arE3-6S1QXhQFG9XNJlp0A.text: Had our reservation for 5pm to get to the show at 7:30.  They sat us outside on the patio so we could watch the fountain water show.   The food was excellent as well as the service.  Getting a table outside at the fountain is pretty easy if you let the hostess know that you'll be out by 6:45 as they have reservations at 7:00 for it.   The seafood risotto was solid!  We will be back.   Two people $85.

m1uOQp67NOTjVCj7kTqkSA.text: This was such a treat. I was a guest of a group of folks that I do business with, and the host ordered in Italian to the head chef, so I am not a great resource when it comes to the menu or pricing.   But... I can speak to the fact that I tried probably 15 different plates throughout the evening, from a caprese appetizer with caviar on top (!) to gnocchi to steak to sea bass to a Black Forest dessert that was the perfect capper. And every single dish was perfection. I love being able to share a wide range of plates with the table and these plates were beyond well executed. They were perfection.   The view of the fountains was lovely, and we could feel a fresh breeze coming off the patio. The service was impeccable and I could not have asked for a better evening! Please, go and enjoy every moment. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas.

55pmpGxnMb-uKnmwKYTYqQ.text: I'm not fond of Italian food at all. My friend invited me to have lunch with him at Lago in Bellagio. Luckily we were seated just right next to Lake Como in a glass enclosure to protect us from the Vegas heat. It's nice they had a pre fix menu since I was on a tight budget. My friend ordered the pre fix menu as well with his being the steak and I had the fish.   The waiter was attentive and quick to check up on us to see how the the food was. The pre fix menu consisted of an appetizer, entree and dessert with each having at least 2-4 choices. It was nice to charge the meal to the room so I can use my resort credit to comp the meal. Overall, Lago won me over with their food and ambiance, for sure I'll come back and try their other dishes.   There's an outer patio overlooking the fountains just as you leave the enclosed patio. Unfortunately no fountain shows were happening at the time.

wIjN2CqHLvEJj7bd-_xpzA.text: Be warned that portions are tapas style: very small and come at a high cost. A bowl of super was close to $20 which of course wouldn't be filling at all.  I really enjoyed the food but found the service to be pretty poor. The waiter only spoke to the gentleman at the table and ignored the females. I wish I had got his name and would have shared with the manager.  Would recommend, but just one time. There are many restaurants on the strip worth trying.

krnxkoO7WF81IF7DEa_v7Q.text: I had a really great time here with my in laws. I had a great evening here and the food overall was really tasty. The service was top notch, and there is a casual but ritzy ambience here.   Favorites:  Salsiccia Pizza- Don't underestimate their pizzas here. This sausage pizza was super yummy!!  Brodetto Di Vongole- The white wine sauce on this with the toasted bread was perfect.  Osso Buco- Super Delicious. Very rich umami and satisfying.   Least Favorites:  Squid Ink Pasta- Garnganelli- not worth the money in my opinion. I've had better squid ink and the dish isn't that filling.  Risotto Di Fuiti Di Mare- This was a decent dish but nothing super special here.

0RupJPrbBn2eQrQJdnbIeg.text: Be careful not to trust them when calling ahead to secure your reservation. Push for a "contract" or risk being downgraded to a crummy table, even if you were promised something better.   I went to Lago with a large group for a birthday party. Unfortunately, the manager and greeters were not what you'd expect at a high-end restaurant. I called ahead and made a reservation for a large group. I explained that I was trying to organize a special night for a birthday party and really wanted to secure a table with a view. The individuals I spoke to assured me that I'd have a table next to the window. I was told that I didn't have enough people in my party to make a group reservation, but that we'd be "taken care of".   I arrive at the restaurant and the manager or some guy in a suit tries to pull the old bait and switch, seating us in some weird booth table away from the windows. I went to speak to the guy in the suit to explain that we'd like the table, which was clearly open and available in the middle of the room towards the window.   His response, that table is only for groups who reserve it in advance. My response, we reserved this well in advance. I printed out and showed him my reservation confirmation. Then he changed his position and said that the large table by the window is "under contract and reserved for another group that's coming in". Perhaps that's True, but my group had specially reserved it as well. After some debate, we were permitted--like the red-headed stepchild--to sit in the table in the front, but we were rushed through our meal to accommodatee the other party who had the table "under contract".   Our waiter was extremely nice and the food was good, which is why I am giving two stars here. Otherwise, I was unimpressed with the restaurant's attempt to downgrade our group and pull the bait and switch, especially with my considerable attempts to coordinate with the restaurant before the event. It's not like I showed up without a reservation. I must have confirmed at least three times prior to that night to ensure that the restaurant and I were on the same page. Instead of ensuring that we were made to feel special, we were cast aside. That's not the way a top-tier restaurant should make customers feel.   I encourage Lago Restaurant executives to get your staff better trained in fine dining and customer care. Your team could have and should have planned ahead to accommodate these seating requests. We arrived at the restaurant around 5:00 pm and there's no reason why you couldn't have arranged three large group tables in the middle of the restaurant. The initial treatment we received nearly ruined the night.

jwMd6Bbd50gMRrHD38aEog.text: Food was okay, but didn't live up to expectations of a fine Italian restaurant. Being from Europe this was not an authentic experience, but rather an American wannabe restaurant, unfortunately. Very small portion sizes, for $25-45 a plate, almost like everything was appetizer portion (this is no Guide Michelin restaurant, you can't do that here!). Service was horrific. Our first server decided to leave during our dinner without notifying us, which resulted in 3 different waiters all "trying" to take care of our table. Rude waiters, and did not care to refill our drinks at any point. An overall very bad dining experience at supposedly a fine Italian restaurant, in a prestigious hotel. If you are looking for an authentic European experience, avoid this restaurant at all costs!  An extraordinary view over the strip though!

photos.caption: Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the restaurant

r_V6paVofmRBb4bamjwE3A.text: Location, location, location! I cannot emphasize enough how amazing the location of this restaurant is. Really. I can't. If you're lucky enough to get a seat by the window, you're in for probably the best dinner view in all of Vegas. We watched the fountains go off numerous times as the sunset throughout dinner, and it was amazing.   Of course, food is just as important as location, and Lago has that under their belt! To start, we ordered the olive Focaccia for the table - definitely didn't realize how small it would be. It was yummy, but essentially as big as a slice of toast. For the main, I ordered the Pappardelle Verdure which was amazing. It had a slightly spicy sauce, can't remember if it was Arabiatta or Marinara, but it was great. The veggies were perfectly cooked and still had a bite to them. I'm not a huge fan of cooked carrots, but I greatly enjoyed it in my pasta here!   We didn't order drinks the day's drinking had already taken a toll on us, but the cocktail menu is extensive and all the drinks looked fantastic. Will definitely be back here next time I'm in Vegas - hopefully I'll have room for a drink!

kVKVRIhXHnZPCInTCBjIlQ.text: I was looking for a perfect place to take my gf for her birthday breakfast in Vegas and I didn't want to go to a buffet or go far off from the strip.   Luckily I found Lago! I made reservations weeks out because I heard that it gets filled up. We got there, asked for an outside reserved table and it was awesome!   We got an amazing view of the Bellagio fountain and the music that it plays with the dancing waters. We were seated outside where they had misters so it wasnt hot accompanied with shade. A heads up though, if you decide to choose outside seating, there might be mist splashing to you when the dancing waters gets close enough and high enough but it's not so much mist that you are anywhere near wet!  Now on to the food. We got steak and eggs with Hashbrowns and a tuna carpaccio topped with a citrus. Both were delicious and refreshing! You can't beat a classic! They also had an AYCE dessert with a chocolate fountain which is a nice and surprising touch to an otherwise, amazing breakfast restaurant.  Service was awesome and attentive. We had an overall great experience and I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic steak and eggs with hashbrowns
Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I believe this is tuna carpaccio topped with citrus

V9yzKpCMRorSgPpVOBx2Cw.text: I always pick Lago for special ocassions when I have friends and family from out of town. Nothing can beat the view of the Bellagio fountains, pair it with a glass of wine and your choice of meal and there you have it. Perfect night! Thank you Lago your staff in and out of the kitchen is amazing, love this place!!!

_YIONK5hZnfnsMYEOAw14A.text: I had a lot of expectations coming to this restaurant and looking at the reviews... honestly it was disappointing.   Pros:  Ricotta cheese and honey on focaccia bread  corkscrew lamb ragu pasta  View of fountain show at Bellagio   Cons: Waiting for ten minutes after having reservations Food did not come out in a timely manner Risotto frutti de mare - watery and rice was so soggy/ soupy Shrimp stuffed squid - nice bite but no flavor  Mushrooms - need more salt  Some of the dishes were too one dimensional, not enough bold flavors and the dish came out a bit too hot.   The staff not being as informative and attentive.  Overall, would I come again? Probably not.

6ATp1hK2St4ZxyZJMAZquQ.text: Brunch review.   3 - MAC CARBONARA (pancetta | egg yolks | pecorino | black pepper) 4 - RAVIOLONE (egg yolk | truffle ricotta | summer truffle butter sauce) 3 - ITALIAN SAUSAGE FRIED EGG BURGER (house made Italian sausage | fried egg) 3 - BACON WRAPPED SCALLOPS AND SHRIMP (saffron risotto)  ++ View/setting (Water side table facing the fountain)  Overall, average brunch, but great view/seats. "I'm a fan."

1jqeuX7sBUsCc_SRavL6Rw.text: Good view to the fountain, can see the water fountain show. Food is also great! Small plates and pricey but worth it

AxQKQ8G2qbpu98biD0HL5A.text: Beautiful setting, incredible service and excellent food!  Arrived at 9:30 PM following a show for our 9:45 reservation booked through the Bellagio concierge.  Hostesses were so pleasant!  Ordered 4 small plates and 3 desserts.  Food quality was wonderful.  Loved the butternut squash soup!  My husband enjoyed the 7 x 7 gnocchi and lobster, would have loved to try but shellfish allergy said no! After 10 pm things quieted down and we could hear the music for the fountains.

LNU_4by_JhAUnf8naEIt9w.text: Staying at the Bellagio this restaurant LAGO   has a awesome view of the water show which is every 15 minutes we was greeted in a timely matter and the staff was excellent the food was taste and was delicious as it looked as you can see by my picture the alcohol selection was awesome . We had a Caesar salad which you can see was very simple and elegant .looking the cheese appetizer we ate wasn't that great .the cheese was not easy to eat with the lavash .maybe the cheese dish I would pass . The pesto dish was delicious and the risotto with seafood was delicious. However was curious why we didn't get a complimentary basket of bread(only given if requested ) however first time how would anyone know to ask for it

LlGBrKqKpDBfiKoWwRM2IA.text: Tapas, Tapas and more Tapas.  I am starting to feel as if everything on the strip is turning into a Tapas only location. But Lago's Tapas are A+++ Stand out. I had the opportunity to try one of the best Veggie Lasagnas I ever had in my life, this thing was cooked to perfection, every flavor just stood right out, I also ordered a margarita pizza, delicious and a must have, please don't ignore the simplicity of the Tomato, it was very flavorful. Now the location brings this restaurant over the top, directly in front of the water show it was beautiful as you walk in look to your right, that wall of wine and champs make for the perfect photo op.  Do not leave this place without getting Dessert! I tried everyone, and I recommend the cheesecake!

ddIopFZIMZryTjVvJ-LSaQ.text: Visited for the first time this weekend for Sunday brunch , and let me just say it was amazing !  Food was delicious , service was attentive and courteous  and the view was breathtaking ! We were able to sit on outdoor patio with front row seats of The Fountains of Bellagio , a definite must !

photos.caption: Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View

9qxWCHV9fz70U4HD0WWspQ.text: Perfect ! After the unpleasant experience at Mott 32 on the other night, we were so happy with our experience at Lago. We were promptly seated right on time of our reservation in the patio where we enjoyed the dancing fountain show. The wait staff was witty, knowledgeable, personable, & very well likable. His recommendation on the plates were excellent. The sommelier's recommendation of champagne & wine was just perfect. The speed of delivering the food, filling in water , drinks, all just perfectly & expertly served in the polite & friendly manner.  After having wonderful (& enormous) brunch at Wing  Lei earlier, we were concerned that we might not be hungry enough for dinner . But this place was just perfect for our party of six. Highly recommend!!!! 5x starts in every way. Wish their continuing success for years to come.

gnKb53auDz9YK2DjomZS0Q.text: Everything that I had was good however the portions were ABSURDLY small for the price you are paying. The view is absolutely stunning and the decor is gorgeous. Wait staff is great and very attentive but you have to drop hundreds of dollars on plates with the tiniest portions. You will walk out hungry and needing a post meal snack. You are supposed to order a bunch of plates and then split it amongst the table but the portions are so small you aren't able to feel fulfilled. Would recommend coming here if you aren't looking for a heavy meal.

GROM2_dppKp3Hm3bFUE7_A.text: Had a terrible experience here. Not sure if it's because we're a party of Asian, but we're still waiting for someone to get our order while the table next to us (came in 10 minutes later) is enjoying their food already.   Food is average, the dining environment is awesome.

GHvgXYAW1nw7TTlKHkubCw.text: Great View of the Bellagio Fountains, awesome cocktails! The red wine and burrata risotto was absolutely delicious and the duck polenta was very impressive. However, the lamb bolognese pasta was good, but it wasn't anything special, and the gnocchi tasted good but the texture was weird.. a little "sandy", never had gnocchi like that before. The desserts were amazing!! We ordered the coffee & chocolate and limoncello desserts, loved both of them but the limoncello one was definitely my favorite! The Service was overall good, had to remind the garcon to get me some water a couple times, but the restaurant was very busy on NYE (understandable, but not an excuse).  The experience at Lago was good, I would go again to taste more of the menu and enjoy the awesome view.

HG0GX7nbUJ7a5YQMAP-Htg.text: Food and atmosphere is great! The bartenders were really nice and if you're lucky you can grab a table outdoors and watch the Bellagio fountain show!

photos.caption: Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine with lobster, calamari, clams and scallops.

MBg_mx9rolAjj6afvyGByQ.text: The view is very nice of the Bellagio water show and the service was great, food came out timely and the menu had lots of options.    Over all the food was really good the only reason it's not a 5 is the price is a lot high for the quality of food.  Paid 500 for 4 people and the steak was not top notch...   for that price I'd have to pass next time.    Enjoy.

W-E9gXuyM-WVy8ODEGHOow.text: Located at the Bellagio Hotel.  This is probably the worst dinning experience I've ever had in Vegas.  We had a reservation at 7:30 but when arrived on time, they had problem locating it and I saw the same happening to other parties.  We ended up not seated until 30 mins later.  It was lots of confusions from one hostess to another.  We were then directed to their outdoor seating but since it was a windy evening, the fountain show canceled, otherwise it would have been a perfect spot to watch the show.  Instead, all we experienced was wind, dust, flying napkins and some circling flies above our table.  The flies told me something is not clean at the restaurant.  On chilly and windy evening like this, I suggest them to turn the outdoor heater up higher or just not offer outdoor sitting since it was hard to chew without dust flying into our mouths.  The tables and chairs were dusty too.  I was worried that my dress would get dirty. The foods we ordered were fair taste but a little pricey for the portion.  The cocktails were good.  The server we had disappeared after dishes served and never checked back until dropping off the bill.   Overall experience was not up to my expectation considering the $$$ spent.  With the many restaurant options on the Strip, I will not return to here.

JeSdw7llNH7cXpr2aTjpsA.text: So we picked this place because it overlooks the Bellagio fountains in the Bellagio. I specifically looked into the pre-fix lunch option because we wanted to save money. When we got there at 2 it was near empty and we were seated near the window. We were not given the pre fix menu and when u asked for it was given a "oh I will have to see if I can do that" I said it's on your website and he very snotty like said he would check. We quickly realized we were not fancy enough for them. He ended up bringing us the menus. We ordered. We also did not order drinks and he pushed them on us and then we were dead to him once he realized he was not going to be getting much out of us. But at $28 each for lunch it's not like it was a cheap meal. the food was okay. looked very pretty and fancy but just ok. Dessert was yummy. Luckily the fountains start at 3 that day so we got to see at least one show right as we were going to leave. It was an amazing view for lunch and if I had the money I would go for dinner!

nAE1vZgZjpRmkJaCugh2gA.text: My brother picked this place for our family Thanksgiving dinner. Our request for a table with a view of the fountain came through and we were seated at a nice square set up where we could all easily share dishes. We got to enjoy the fountain show all dinner long.    The first thing to know about this place is that it's a tapas place so most dishes are small shareable dishes. Each of those will run you from $12-27 each. Larger entrees are available for $50-65. Most of the dishes were tasty. Some of the food that stood out for us were: Braised duck over polenta 7and7 - lobster and gnocchi though I found the gnocchi to be overdone.  Grilled octopus with squid ink pasta  Clams in spicy sauce Cappuccino mousse dessert  They added a few dishes for Thanksgiving: Butternut squash ravioli - quite yummy Turkey dish with green beans and sweet potato puree was okay Pumpkin tiramisu was good  Service was excellent and super attentive. I did appreciate all of their great service on a evening that they could have been spending it with their family. Many thanks and happy Thanksgiving!!

KnJYterzVC5ngdyLcWp1SA.text: My sister came to Vegas for her 50th birthday, so I thought LAGO would be a special place. I WAS WRONG!! We specified that the reservation was for a birthday and even reminded the host. After we were presented with the bill and no birthday wish or birthday cake or anything I asked to speak to the manager who was FABIO RUSSO, he made the situation worse by listening to what I had to say and saying or doing absolutely nothing about the situation. In my opinion and I have owned and operated many restarants, FABIO RUSSO is unfit for the job, get rid of him, he is ruining the busienss and the brand. EIWXKzIeguUVGTbDQjb2aQ.text: They say to order 2-3 dishes per person because the courses are, "small". The first dish to arrive was the wagyu beef. When it arrived we were underwhelmed. The taste was subpar, and we could barely finish not even half of the wagyu. The waiter (AFTER we ordered) informed us that the wagyu beef was supposedly the only dish that came in larger proportions. However, the next dish to arrive was the burrata. When it arrived it too was larger than we had expected. Our waiter, Monique, argued back and forth with us that these were how the dishes are supposed to come. At this point had we known the proportions would be as large as they were, we would've ordered the pasta and nothing more. It tasted mediocre, and the accompanying crackers to the wagyu and the burrata were the same. Which tells us the variation between dishes were uninventive. Next was the chicken liver spread. The presentation was good, however when you bite into the crostini it's very hard. The pepperoncino was excessive, and made it extremely spicy. A smaller amount would've enhanced the course. Finally, the seafood bucatini arrived. The taste was decent, especially in comparison to the other dishes. Overall if you're looking for great Italian food, this is not it. We now see why it was ranked number 7 in the search for Italian food in Las Vegas.

ERsQ5chxrlrZEduHT6erFw.text: Want to experience Michelin starred and James Beard awarded rated Chef Julian Serrano's culinary offerings in the Bellagio?  Oh, chef's name may invoke his Spanish heritage and one's thoughts go to dishes that would include chorizos, sangria, tapas or paella. But, think again...you're IN THE BELLAGIO!  So, in Lago, you'll find Chef Serrano's bold Italian cuisine for brunch or dinner service.    We came here to experience the Sunday Brunch that was highly recommended by friends and the hotel's concierge.  Reservations are definitely recommended.  Upon approach, this bright space and colorful mosaic (of Milan) attracted us from the casino.  We also noted that a dessert display had been set up at the front of restaurant.  There is also a lobby or lounge to wait for the rest of your party to arrive as the hostesses won't seat your party unless everyone is present.  As we were guided to our table, past the bar and lounge area, we could see out of the huge glass window from which we clearly viewed a panorama of The Fountains of Bellagio.  During our brunch, we watched the fountains dance about to popular or classical music selections.  Our friendly server described the fixed Sunday 3-Course Brunch menu which included a basket of assorted Italian breakfast pastries AND a "visit" to the dessert display.  For a few dollars more, you can request unlimited Bloody Marys or Mimosas with your brunch which makes more sense than ordering by the glass.  We each selected our 1st and 2nd courses from the menu while munching on the pastries set at our table and sipped on our coffees or cocktails.  The third course was a trip to the luscious dessert bar which we did our best to save room in our stomachs for.  The nice thing about the 3-course brunch is that the portions are sensible and satisfying so you won't feel like you'll go into a food coma.  The authentic Italian flavors can range from bright to bold which are great for waking one up.  This was a sophisticated and enjoyable Sunday Brunch which we shared  with good friends over a stunning view of Lake Lago and the famous Bellagio Fountains.

qRpVDRpLs17HX_m8mycAZw.text: I got a pick a place to eat at for a company sponsored dinner and Lago had been a place I have wanted to try it for so long.  I made a reservation a week before and we were sat almost immediately upon arrival. We got a really nice seat, two tables from the window. We picked a time where the fountain shows were just starting so we got to see a beautiful show every 15 minutes.  The service was not the best I have ever had. I felt like our waiter paid more attention to the table next to mine. The restaurant wasn't that busy either so I kinda expected better service. We waited for a water refill for a long time.  The food however made up for the service. We had to try the small plates so we had a few of those along with one regular dinner plate. The Gnocchi with lobster is a must. The lobster was delicious, and the Gnocchi was one of the best Gnocchis I have ever had. The veal was a little too sour for my taste, so next time I will pass on that. We also had one of the sashimi plates, which was melt in your mouth. A little pricey, but delicious. Finally, the lamb chops were perfectly cooked and I really enjoyed that dish.  The plates were small, but full of flavor. I think ordering a few small plates and one side is the perfect amount of food for two people.   The meal was quite pricey, but with the beautiful restaurant, the wonderful view, and the high quality food I will definitely be back for more some day. It was a wonderful experience and I cannot wait to bring some friends.

ffZI98YOuKapBAYO0Dy4Eg.text: We were fortunate enough to be able to score a same-day reservation for dinner on a warm Thursday evening. What we didn't know was that somehow, we were able to get one of three best tables in the house - the front and center fountain facing balcony tables! What an amazing view and experience it was.  DECOR The ambiance, decor, and atmosphere of Lago is clean, bright, with a lake house feel - more so outside on the patio than in the main dining room. The balcony overlooking the famed Bellagio fountains was a treat. An additional element of our experience was having a front row unobstructed view of the Bellagio Fountains show every 15 minutes!  FOOD Lago by Julian Serrano is an Italian Tapas-style restaurant with a focus on fresh seafood dishes created with style and bursts of flavor. For libations, we tried a selection from the cocktail menu: the Lago cocktail and Sgroppino for her and the Rose & Rye and the Serrano "Leather-Aged" Negroni. Our dinner consisted of five tapas: Pesce Al Cartoccio, Brodetto Di Vongole, Capasanta Alla Putanesca, Hamachi Crudo, Oysters, and a finish of an amazingly crafted limoncello dessert.  Our first course consisted of Kumomoto oysters and Hamachi Crudo. The oysters were fresh, crisp, and had a tangy red wine mignonette accompanying them. The take on the Hamachi was also refreshing; Dressed in a fresh cucumber juice, spicy oil, and micro greens, it was bliss on the palate. Our second course consisted of a traditional clams dish in a white wine braise and scallops in a tomato boquerone sauce. The clams reminded me of fresh buckets of white wine garlic clams I used to get growing up at the Redondo Beach Pier. The scallops were prepared perfectly and paired well with what I thought would be an overpowering combination of tomato and boquerone. Our main course was the fresh fish of the day en papillote, the branzino. The branzino was accompanied by a caponata, and while not being a huge fan of eggplant, I loved it!.  The grand finale was the dessert. I would suggest this, along with the creative cocktails, was the stars of our meal. This dessert was just called 'limoncello' but it was so much more. It combined elements of limoncello, pastry, chocolate, and fruit that had us wanting to order another.  Every dish was a creative use of fresh ingredients highlighting the main ingredients. We thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our meal from the moment we stepped up to the entry, throughout our meal with the Bellagio fountains dancing in the background every quarter of the hour, to the dessert.

lReltbL0TTvW-gT4vgfL3g.text: Perfect for our belated anniversary dinner! It's in the Bellagio which earns points right away since that's my favorite casino. The decor is vibrant and elegant. The view of the Bellagio fountains is spectacular. We were seated right by the window and saw three different versions of the fountain show.   We each started with a glass of wine and the ricotta honey focaccia, which I highly recommend. I had the mushroom risotto, and my husband had the ragu - both excellent. We ate everything and then each ordered creme brulee. Plus, I ordered the after-dinner coffee drink.   I researched menus and places to celebrate a special occasion in Vegas with a view. This hit on everything I was looking for and the price was in line with what I expected for such a meal. The service was also spot on from the hostess to the clearing of our plates. They have it all covered here.  Make a reservation and enjoy!

doyd-NFiodlMuDa-nfpAag.text: Came to visit my wife for lunch at the Bellagio.  We were looking for a cafe. Well this is nothing like a cafe.  It's like a fine dining but for lunch.  The service was very impressive. Staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable of their menu.  We started with the pizza which is fired stone cooked. I think. I don't know but the crust , It's perfectly crisp.  We also tried the Ceasar salad add salmon to it.  Very nicely dressed light and filling.  The fruit de mare pasta was a little too spicy for me but I finished it. Just had to drink a lot of water. (Lol)  My wife had the stuffed lobster ravioli. I didn't get to try it but I will next time. Will definitely come back to try the rest of the menu.

qVP_-EdBOOADSuPLDwBsTg.text: The food was cooked to perfection. I asked for a steak medium, and I have to admit I have never experienced a better "medium". Additionally, every plate was delectable! Then... why only 3 stars? Because for me the experience is also important... it all started good... we got a great waitress (who, by the way, had served my wife and daughter the night before), but even before we could get our drinks ordered, she was changed to a different area... and the new waiter even though kind, seemed new and/or stressed. Then, I ordered a Lagavulin 16 (single malt scotch, for those who may not be familiar with it). When he brought it, it tasted like Laphroaig 10. And, don't get me wrong... I like Laphroaig 10 too, but that was not the taste I was looking for. I brought it up to the waiter's attention and he was kind enough to bring the Lagavulin bottle and gave me a taste from it, and... it definitely tasted different. So, I asked him to please replace my drink. Which he did promptly and I was able to enjoy my Lagavulin 16 taste... All seemed ok... then why, again, only 3 stars??? Because when I got the bill there was a $4.00 difference on the price of the Lagavulin. And again... don't get me wrong... it is NOT about the $4.00 dollars! It is about the principle! I was not going to be that customer who complains about the $4.00 dollars.... after getting our waiter changed and getting the wrong drink, this was the "drop" that spilled the cup... not worth a fight or complain, but enough to leave a "3 star only" taste in my mouth!

n4xfvzD6Kc6wzxbgEBEBJQ.text: Lago thank you for creating an absolutely perfect birthday dinner for my mom. Mom's only request for our Vegas weekend was to see the Bellagio fountains...Well what better place to see them than over dinner at Lago. Our table was directly facing the center of the fountains and immersed us directly into the show. We absolutely enjoyed every moment of it (especially mom).   The menu is perfect for sharing with a group of any size. The three of us ordered six different dishes and loved them all. Attention to detail in each dish's flavor and presentation was perfect. Beautiful wine list and creative cocktails.   Thank you Lago for a truly wonderful experience.

hjKzSfoDZe3dbW36C7Z9cg.text: This restaurant is so much more about the view than the food. Although the food is good to very good, the view of the fountains is amazing. A reservation is a must in order to get a window seat though so plan ahead. The food was good, small plates described like you're eating at an incredibly authentic Italian restaurant but are lacking just that tiny extra taste to send them into the "delicious" category. For small plates they actually are generously sized for two people. The bruschetta is a must and the meatballs are really yummy. Lamb ragu was good, I would have preferred different noodles, the spirals made me think of Kraft mac and cheese but the sauce was great. Skip the seafood salad...the grapefruit was overpowering and the shredded veggies were blah. Bread and oil are brought to the table only by request so be sure to ask!

rOoQASc6thaJF1Qf7puWeA.text: What an amazing experience we had for Sunday Brunch! The $28 unlimited drinks was so worth it and our server kept the drinks coming even before we were done drinking. The food was out of this world and with so much elegance. One the chef came and spoke with us as he knew we spoke in Spanish! An amazing place with the best view!

PZJVaRm_5zrQJ2Kgi-VnoA.text: I brought my girl friend here for her birthday and we had a great view just right by the window where you can see the fountain.  We ordered yummy passion fruit mojito cocktails that came with real passion fruit. Great drink. It was more than our entree! We ordered the short rib entree and seafood risotto. The portions are very small, so if you came for a light dinner before a night out, this is the perfect spot for that. We also ordered two desserts which were pretty big portions and very delicious.

NSTeOsVxcVCE6JwLlm7kiw.text: Really nice food, views, service, ambiance. Upscale, modern excellence.  Everything was so good.

a0krRT8la0DTCZcRy-oyaw.text: Pssstt, Julian, stick to tapas!  My wife and I love Picasso and we've eaten at Julian Serrano's about half a dozen times.  "Go check out Julian Serrano's at the Aria," we tell people when they ask us where to eat.   We'll make sure to tell them to stay away from Lago from now on.  I've already gotten some rather brutal feedback on my review so I'm editing it to provide more information as to why we were so incredibly disappointed with our meal at Lago.   First and foremost, service was extremely spotty.   We were initially seated at a table, immediately told to move as there could be no table there as it was blocking the doors onto the balcony.   We were moved to a table nearby only to see that a new larger table of 6 was dressed exactly in the same spot some 15 minutes later.   Perhaps they didn't want to sacrifice such "prime" real estate on a 2-top, but we certainly felt slighted to say the least.   For the remainder of the meal, it was evident the servers were much more interested in lavishing attention on larger parties.   We asked twice for water refill while our glasses remained empty.   Sorry, but that just doesn't fly.  The food was simply not all that spectacular.   The octopus dish I had was rather chewy with a rather crude presentation, in my opinion.   The polenta might have been the highlight of the meal, but that's really not saying much.  In all fairness, it's perfectly evident that an extraordinary Spanish Chef can create incredible tapas but he may not so easily be able to create such exquisite Italian dishes.   If you want incredible French fare, go eat at a restaurant run by a French Chef.   Same goes for Spain, Italy, or Thailand.  Considering we dropped close to 5 bills on our meal here, we had much higher expectations.   Of course, many things can be excused.   Perhaps the sous-chef was ill that day.   Nevertheless, the lack of culinary depth combined with what we thought rather poor customer service made that we certainly won't be coming back.

ChrH_G408O2x92EparEctQ.text: We came here for lunch on a Wednesday and it was packed. Even though we had a reservation, we still had to wait 20 minutes which sucked.  Once we were in, the magic began. The decor was really fancy and classy. It felt super up scale. Our server was great too. He was really attentive throughout our meal and was really helpful and knowledgeable about the menu.  We chose a bunch of different dishes and shared family style.  Highlights: The Agnolotti. Wow. The insides were just so smooth. I really enjoyed this.  We tried the different pizzas. I like the salsicca the most. I didn't think I would like the pizza as much as I did but it was a good addition!  The bistecca was too cooked for my taste. It was medium :/ I didn't really like this.   The sea bass was great. It tasted really fresh!  Overall, a really good place. I would love to come again!

KqbDy1QaRsltOxJFLqVe-w.text: Wonderful food and views!!  Also I found the value to be pretty good for the quality of the food and service.   Dined here recently on two separate work trips. The restaurant has an amazing view of the Bellagio fountain from the inside. The restaurant even queues the music to match the fountain when it is going.   The food itself is wonderful. I really liked the gnocchi dish and found it to be delicious. All mainly small plates to great for sharing. Service is also good. Had servers both times that were attentive but not too much lingering.   Hit this place up for sure when dining in Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States

URp4-Nk4s20CEY4wszpVaA.text: Ambience: 5 Food: 4  Service by Monique D: 3  I could rate it an overall 4 stars but taking into account the type of restaurant this is and what I expected of it I shall give it 3 stars instead. My pasta ai frutti di mare was delicious but the veal piccata just had too many capers for my taste. From that dish all I could taste was lemon and capers.  Also take into account that the dishes do not come with any sides; those you need to order separately.  For dessert I had their Gianduiotto and it was beautiful, refined and had a nice flavor/texture combination. But would I order it again? Probably not.  As for the service I'd say it that although sufficiently efficient it was as impersonal as it can get. Monique D, at least three times, left me with half my question still being processed by my brain. That's unacceptable. She had two tables, both close, so I know it was not because she was 'on the weeds'. Was it because I'm young and look like I could also eat at Pizza Hut? To top it off, when she dropped the bill, she had charged one of the items as if it had been dinner time and it was not. The difference was small of course but still a mistake. I did not tell her to fix it (she was not around much), nor did I tip her my usual 20%. Hope she gets better at her job, smiles once in a while or just considers changing her job.

miP_CGTKu6SUg6wfLHjSZw.text: Ok. It's the belaggio we know but c'mom absolutely overpriced for what you get.    Loud loud busy ambience.  The fountain view is pretty. Service is hit and miss. They bus your table like a living on land octopus hands in and out everywhere- getting things you want takes some time.   The wine stewards are exceptional though.  Granted a 130$ bottle of champagne is 40$ in the store they do jump for their money.    A lot of pomp and not much oomph at this establishment- the entrees are expensive. Decent not mind blowing. The so called shareable dishes are funny. 6 of us barely got a bite of some of the items.     6 gnocchi balls 6 lobster knuckles the same size as the gnocchi were 22$  we're not cheap but was shocked tasted very good even though I almost missed it as I chewed 3 times and down it went.    I don't mean to complain about Lago it is Vegas and it's all about excess and spending but next time we will skip this fine fancy sexy establishment with lovely plates and very nice Turkish cotton napkins which I wish I would have stole at least one if not a pair.      So if you wanna be a big spender go a different route.     But the baked fish was yummy and the crepe brulee was pretty damn good. Very very worth it.   Good luck in Vegas.   Good advice: Don't take the cards they are handing out - downtown they will give them to you. Like reverse pigeons

aVxq0tsfi5IaQ-e4sX9tkA.text: The most amazing dining experience I have ever had. We had a party of 6, we made reservations and asked for the patio and they delivered. Beautiful views of the fountain! The patio does have heaters on it so even in the chilly winter air it was comfortable. Our server, Antonio, was AMAZING!!! He made sure he knew our plans for the night so he could get us out in time for our show. He knew the menu like the back of his hand and was an absolute delight. The food was also wonderful! I 100% would recommend this place.

FSKzsrmXy1Ci7glbeuBenA.text: Went here with a group of friends. The service was excellent. We had a decent view of the fountains. My friend said the lamb chops were quite possibly the best he's had. He eats at lots of upscale places as well. The sommelier provided excellent advice on a wine pairing as well. It's a great place to go on a nice, romantic date. It's pricey, but on par with other like restaurants in Vegas.

tHe5MZRKLXFvsdkOdv3s5g.text: Really really disgusting overpriced food. We were a party of 10, this is shared opinion.  Some appetizers are ok like, but main course is a disaster. I ordered a steak medium well which came out bloody. After I asked them to cook it again it was still way undercooked. The meat quality is very low. They use a lot of oil and sauce to mask the low quality of food.  Do yourself a favor and go literally anywhere else.

q0HnJn3-F2RXd0zu1jfDnQ.text: The food at Lago is definitely five stars! I've never ordered anything that wasn't top notch! The first time I went there, I ordered the branzino livornese. I loved it! The only other time I've had branzino was at Bardot brasserie and theirs was terribly bland! The one at Lago is definitely more flavorful! I took a bite out of my friend's dish which was the Crusted Salmon and oh my, that was is also bursting with flavors! If you want to order a fish, I would definitely go for either of those two!  My second time around, I went with their three course tasting menu and ordered the caprese salad, Petto di pollo ripieno, and the hazelnut cake. My friend ordered the tonno and the anatra e polenta. The caprese salad was yummy! The tomatoes were fresh and so was the cheese. It had the perfect amount of saltiness. The chicken was a little overdone but still flavorful! The mashed potatoes that came with it was amazing! It was creamy and the sauce on it was just yums! No words could explain it. My friend's duck dish was also delicious! If you had shrimp and grits, it's kind of similar. I would want to order it next time. The two desserts I've tried is the hazelnut cake and the panna cotta and both are exceptionally delicious!   So the jist of it all, everything was flavorful and delicious. Docking off one star because I literally had to hunt down just to get a water refill and that's my biggest pet peeve. You should always keep the waters and drinks filled.   Oh well! I will definitely be coming back in the near future.   ANATRA E POLENTA

Btucnaz6FmGuqCu6aajU6g.text: Come for a meal and the bellagio waterworks. Th-th-that's all folks.  Food was underwhelming.

RA6nDgN5uycHkiaxwycShg.text: So we made reservations at 10:15 but had to wait 20 extra minutes to be seated by the window for the most beautiful Las Vegas view.  Lago is a newest restaurant by Michelin Starred Chef Julian Serrano; located in the Bellagio, which is a new rendition of a contemporary Italian themed Cuisine which just opened in April, 2015.  THE STAFF -  While our servers were not on their best behaviors, the food picked up their charm. The tables are so close that the waiter's  butt kept jabbing me to assist the table next to me and he never said sorry, it almost felt like he wanted his butt in my face!   THE FOOD -  Pasta fagioli e cozze -  this soup with muscles which my dining companions couldn't stop raving about. It was delightful and had a bit of clean yet rustic flavor without being overwhelming with salt.  I had their Cesar salad, and I rarely compliment salad dishes, but the seasoned sardines blew me away, it was really magnificent.  The texture of the vegetables and croutons was one of the, if not the best mixture I've experienced from a salad dish.  Risotto di fruti di mare - My second course was the Risotto, which was probably the best risotto dishes I've had in Las Vegas, with elegant and aromatic flavor and impeccable texture of the farro. I hadn't distinguished what trick the kitchen pulled off, but the king oyster and maitake mushroom tasted almost like a flawless grilled meat, with smoked macadamia and crispy leeks to support the mushrooms.   Pesce fish - orata which was perfectly cooked but the reserved yet elegant flavor of curry broth added another dimension to this dish and the flavor was modest without being salty.  I would definitely recommend coming here again.  It's my top 5.

E_upMLLE28-QtEVvAOSJ1A.text: The view of the fountains during sunset and later in the evening are 5 stars. Make sure if your going to this restaurant you're going for the view, sit by the window tables. Otherwise, it's not worth it.   Now this is why I'm eating it only 2 stars.  There is a lady that comes by your table to take photos of you. That is so touristy and cheesy. Makes dinner awkward and not as intimate. I mean we're just at dinner, do we really need to be this cheesy?!   Second,  The food is garbage. The Cesar salad was tasteless. The bruschetta was the only okay thing we had ordered. But again just okay. I ordered Pacherri de Telefono, baked pasta. Ummm.. did it ever come out! It was the smallest dish I had ever seen. It was like an appetizer for maybe 2 people.   My hubby ordered Pappardelle Al Sugo Bugiardo. It was a sauce. There was 1 strand of think pasta in it and the rest of it was roasted veggies in tomato sauce. We make better pasta at home.   I also ordered a cucumber mint drink that tasted awful. I took maybe 2 sips and left it hanging.   Then, the bill. We skipped dessert because I'm sure it wasn't going to blow our minds.   But... the bill! Was $95.00  For lame pasta and sauce- gross salad   I can't believe how $$$ this place was for the quality and quantity of its food.   I would watch the fountains outside for free. And eat someplace else.

Mw6foSlOltvjoEbgOVW8RQ.text: Lago is my favorite restaurant on The Strip. I should note I don't eat beef so if steak is your thing, this is probably not the restaurant for you. Also, if you want a giant pile of food on your plate for relatively short money this is also not your place. But if you like to tapas/small plates style of eating or if you don't want to leave feeling like you might burst then go here.   Lago puts you eye level with the water show so ask for a window seat. It can be a bit loud in the restaurant during peak times (acoustics, not blasting music or anything like that) but if the weather is not too hot you can ask for outdoor seating and it is much quieter outside. It's the best outdoor seating on the Strip, and there's not a lot of outdoor seating on the Strip! Book in advance if you want window seats or outdoor seating. (Another good thing about Lago is it has a bathroom IN the restaurant so you don't have to walk out of the restaurant and into the casino. Which might not sound important, but it sort of is. Also, it is a really nice and private bathroom! Though, they do use sage scented hand soap which is the bane of my existence....)  I like to dress up and you won't feel overdressed at Lago if you want to get dressy. But you don't have to. Casino's will seat people wearing just about anything, so smart casual is fine.   I would get a reservation for any Strip restaurant. You can always cancel if you change your mind.   I love the food here. There's a sister restaurant in Aria- Jullian Serrano Tapas- which is equally good but is interior to the casino so has no views.

m5y_C_sEXLnazgNFv9EB6A.text: This is a stellar brunch choice! Three courses. Delicious mimosas and bloody marys! We ordered carbonara and ahi to start. The carbonara is off the charts--rich, flavorful, filling, so yummy! The tuna was a perfect pair with it,as it was very clean and light. If I could have a do over-- I'd order the duck though. It looked delish. Next was a calzone and the chicken. Both good choices. The calzone could've been better. Starting with simply putting fresh mushrooms in-- not the gross canned white ones. The crust was very nice and the ham was tasty. The dessert bar is quite a scene-- Chocolate fountain and cotton candy maker! The sweets were very good.  Enjoyed the view of the bellagio fountain too. A lovely way to spend a Sunday !

photos.caption: Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view
Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi

Eez6GgmH7eGmOHLll8D0tQ.text: Amazing food with a gorgeous view of the Bellagio water show, and the strip. Yummy craft cocktails, and the food is out of this world!  Our group tried:  Truffle pasta- Creamy and dreamy.  Caprese - you could taste the sunshine in the tomatoes, and the cheese was buttery soft! Sashimi- Bright, fresh, delicious. Wagyu beef dish- Melt in your mouth beef, with a side of the most buttery, crispy little potatoes Veggie Lasagna-  Cheesy, perfect pasta and sauce.  Service was stellar!

khn22O3PUuRTQ7xiyXoiSg.text: I was excited to come here but was overall very disappointed in the food. We got the Margherita pizza and pesto pasta and both were pretty mediocre. The pizza was pretty much like a frozen pizza. The crust was tough and really didn't have much flavor. The cheese was rubbery and the sauce was boring. The pesto didn't even taste like pesto...it tasted mostly like oil. There was almost no basil flavor to it. For what I paid, I was kind of annoyed by how bad the food was. The service was very good, though...but that never really makes up for lackluster food.  So disappointed in my dining experience here, especially since we had to pull all the stops to even get a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0px9dOSqyabSi_mwaYxmnQ.text: We celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary dinner here. This restaurant is located inside Bellagio. We reserved a window table so that we can watch the "fountain" while eating. Food was great. Server is friendly. Wish they have more food options. We ordered dessert and it included a "happy anniversary" note written in chocolate! Love it.

y67VJhhqBcu4eLSvARAmSw.text: Closed for lunch but they do have a small tasting menu that you can try at the bar and high tables.  The drinks were amazing! We tried a Mojito and a rye and cherry cocktail.  Both had flowers in them.  The caprese salad was my favorite.  The salmon was very good and fresh.  The ribeye was our least favorite.  It was cut in flat squares and the sauce was too heavy for us.  The restaurant is beautiful.

photos.caption: Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon
Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carpascio
Photo of Lago - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Capers salad

E6tD39pABjbI3UaVyHgkyw.text: Pro: - Had a reservation with a nice view so it was nice to see the show  Cons: - Understandably, tapas are generally small portions. The price however, doesn't really justify the each dish picked. Food was just ok and portion was much smaller than other tapas in other places. - Service was slow.

UddWPTykju5TU-m9ewpmCA.text: Views of fountains are beautiful but don't go for the food! Have a drink and a small bite to justify getting a table but don't spend the money! I love Julian Serrano's original but the food at Lago is mediocre. Pasta was more than al dente and the burrata while fresh was topped with a  bland tomato dressing  and the bread too heavy. Everything tasted the same. Disappointing!!!

SKWre5ytIPDDMj5lqGAipQ.text: We had 10+ dishes.  We all liked seafood with linguine and most people liked lobster with gnocchi.  Both dishes were 4 stars.  Good ambiance.  All the other dishes were mediocre.  Octopus was too salty specially black couscous.  Sashimi dish was really...please take if off the menu.  $20 parking didn't help.  When I spend about $100 per person I expect more than mediocre food.  If you go here for the fountain view which is great, try classic Italian dishes like seafood linguine or pizza.

9__Yg6c8RuiCjND0Q8GsHg.text: I love their Prix Fixe lunch- $28 and everything is awesome.  Had a caprese salad, bronzino with capers and baby tomatoes and asparagus and a lemoncello cake for dessert.  Sat outside and it was the quietest spot I have been able to find at the Bellagio.  Will definitely come back here!

rVQytsGOjAYFUHiu3ddT4g.text: My husband and I dined here on April 20th to celebrate our 13th wedding anniversary. I was lucky enough to get to attend the Gold Elite event held at Lago the previous week, so I knew I was in for a great meal in a beautiful setting. My expectations were met and then some.   We arrived promptly for our 6 pm reservation and we were lead by the personable hostess to our reserved table on the patio, overlooking the famous Bellagio fountains and the Eiffel Tower across the street at Paris. The manager came over to thank us for celebrating our anniversary with them, and then our server, Carlos, proceeded to explain the menu to us.   Lago is Italian themed tapas, so many of the menu items are intended to be shared, and very few of the items could be considered a meal on their own. Carlos explained that items are brought out as soon as they are prepared, and recommended we start with a couple dishes and then order more as the night went on.   Service was impeccable. While Carlos was our main server, we interacted with various other employees as food was brought out to us and dishes were removed from the table. Everyone was fantastic.   My husband and I started out by sharing a few items and then decided to move on to 2 of the larger entrees. The insalata sarda was a wonderfully light dish to start off with, and I loved the way the brown sugar and balsamic brought out the flavor of the ricotta infornata. After sampling a couple more items we moved on to our entrees, my husband had the polletto and I had the filetto. My steak was such a deliciously tender cut of meat and gorgonzola with red wine reduction topping was to die for.   We could not resists sharing a dessert after our entrees, we went with the panna cota which was a wonderful combination of vanilla and citrus. Our server Carlos said it was a favorite of his, and that was a wonderful recommendation on his part.   Lago was an excellent venue for us to celebrate our marriage, and a lovely addition to the Bellagio property.

tfr6DKSf_bShU7zvTNYjlQ.text: WE LOVED LAGO! My parents and husband and I celebrated my mom's 65th birthday at Julian Serrano's newest restaurant in the Bellagio, and they showed us the best time. Memorably warm and attentive service, memorably dramatic and beautiful fountain views, and memorably fun and satisfying dishes.  We had chicken liver crostinis, guanciale and fava focaccia, green and white asparagus, margherita pizza, corkscrew pasta with lamb ragu, risotto with red wine and burrata, potato gnocchi with lobster knuckles, and the softest meatballs, and this--about two dishes per person--was the perfect sized meal. My favorite dish was the risotto with red wine and burrata--it hit all of my comfort food markers for being soft and creamy and savory, and a little tangy. I also loved the chicken livers, and the doughiness of the focaccia. Was anything the best I've ever eaten? No, but nothing was remotely disappointing! This is beautiful Italian food--sometimes very subtle or simple, but always very pleasing.  A note on the cocktails and wine list--the cocktails are strong and the pours are very generous. Don't let the price tag turn you away.  I definitely want to go back, and maybe next time I'll remember to take a picture. But I don't think I'll lose the image of the fountains, and my mom's overjoyed face as a complimentary birthday dessert arrived, anytime soon.

gEh61qty-R3gMD9MwM0IeQ.text: I'd been hearing all kinds of positive buzz about Lago, since it had only opened to the public a week or two before my arrival in Vegas.  I assumed that scoring a reservation would be damn near impossible -- especially since my visit coincided with Vegas Uncork'd -- and no seats appeared to be available on OpenTable.  However, the Bellagio concierge took pity and managed to save me a seat at the bar.  Score!  I was totally thrilled to get this reservation, because Lago is simply marvelous.  It's the latest concept from Julian Serrano, featuring Italian small plates.  Located right on Lake Bellagio (where Circo used to be), the space is bright and inviting, with lots of whites and cool blues and intricate glass tilework.  The fountain show wasn't running the night I dropped by, due to inclement weather, but that didn't seem to bother anyone.  The vibe inside was just electric.  After being seated, I was greeted by Will, who's probably the friendliest and most courteous bartender I've met on the Strip.  He wasted no time getting a cocktail in front of me.  I opted for the Sicilian "gin and tonic" with a crispy orange chip and blood orange spheres.  This cocktail was simply gorgeous, and packed a serious kick.  Lago definitely puts a lot of thought into its cocktail program.  Since the menu was done in the style of small plates, I decided to try an array of different items.  Five plates seemed right for a reasonably hungry person:  1.  Nduja crostini with spicy pork sausage and gorgonzola 2.  Capasanta -- scallop crudo with blood orange and pistachio 3.  Short rib cannelloni with parmesan fonduta and tomato 4.  Quagia saltimbocca -- boneless quail with prosciutto 5.  Ravioli al gamberi -- ravioli with shrimp, mascarpone, and tomato  Picking a favorite from these dishes is damn near impossible, since I adored them all for different reasons.  The nduja had a nice spice, which was a good contrast to the cool and fresh scallop crudo.  The canneloni was probably the most traditional item, but the flavor was amazing.  The quail was rich and decadent without being heavy.  The ravioli pretty much melted in my mouth.  Even after all this delicious food, I knew I couldn't leave without trying one of their mouthwatering desserts.  Will recommended the Giandujotto -- hazelnut ice cream with hazelnut/chocolate cream encased in a chocolate shell, all served with chocolate ribbons.  This dessert was stunning to look at and tasted fabulous as well.  Yeah, it's pretty much an Instagrammer's dream come True.  Something about Lago puts its guest in a great mood, because everyone sitting near me was more chatty and outgoing than usual, and wanted to know every detail about the food I was ordering.  Lago truly feels like a destination restaurant for Vegas food aficionados, and that's reason enough for me to return.
